Home > Stories > GreenKayak

GreenKayak - free trip with kayak for collection trash

Kayaking on the canals of Copenhagen or Amsterdam can be very romantic and enjoyable.

Unfortunately, these channels, as well as most of the channels in Western Europe, are contaminated.

This is a problem that the people of GreenKayak are trying to solve

GreenKayak is an environmental NGO that aims to give as many people as possible

the chance to engage with the fight against pollution. They believe that giving people

a connection to nature is the way to create lasting change. We offer volunteers free

trips in their GeenKayaks in return for collecting trash from the water and sharing

their experiences on social media with #greenkayak.

GreenKayaks hold two people. They’re stable and they’re safe – you don’t need to

have kayaked before to take one out – and they give you lifejackets and all the other

gear you need to paddle and pick up waste.

Since 2017, several thousand volunteers have paddled GreenKayaks in the harbors,

rivers and lakes of 5 countries across Europe, and collected almost 25 tons of trash.

They also have a mobile fleet of 10 GreenKayaks that they use to do activations and

events with schoolkids and youth groups. They share our knowledge on grassroots

engagement with institutions like the European Environmental Agency. And they are

currently working on building a global network of GreenKayaks.

You can visit GreenKayak.com and support them.
